did.head: Overview of the Collection
did.abstract: Plantation diary (farm journal) kept at "Coggins Point" Farm, 1841-1843, by Edmund Ruffin (b. 1814), lists slaves grouped by task, gives weather information, and describes farming operations, also bears the name of Henry W. Mead, New Baltimore

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Collection is open to all researchers.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Before publishing quotations or excerpts from any materials, permission must be obtained from the Manuscripts and Rare Books Librarian, and the holder of the copyright, if not Swem Library.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Plantation diary (farm journal) kept at "Coggins Point" Farm, 1841-1843, by Edmund Ruffin (b. 1814), lists slaves grouped by task, gives weather information, and describes farming operations, also bears the name of Henry W. Mead, New Baltimore

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Other farm journals of Edmund Ruffin, Jr. are in the Southern Historical Collection, University of North Carolina.
